Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Rev. Jonnel C. Doris, Pastor Full Gospel Assembly Of Queens, 89-17 114th Street, Richmond Hill, N.Y. 11418.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Koslowitz.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Rev. Jonnel C. Doris, Pator Full Gospel Assembly of Queens, 89-17 114th Street, Richmond Hill, N.Y. 11418.

Council Member Koslowitz moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 5, 2017 be adopted as printed by Council Member Chin.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Chin moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of April 5, 2017 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By Council Member Kallos:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 1678 3rd Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 8, Application No. 20175235 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: This Land Use Call-Up was Approved, by Council
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Barking Dog - 1678 3rd Ave, Manhattan (20175235 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 174 2nd Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 3, Application No. 20175305 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Mamak - 174 2nd Ave, Manhattan (20175305 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Mendez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 442 3rd Avenue, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 6, Application No. 20175243 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, 442 3rd Ave, Manhattan (20175243 TCM)

Items.Title:
By Council Member Rodriguez:
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and §20-226 or §20-225 of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk café located at 251 Dyckman Street, Borough of Manhattan, Community Board 12, Application No. 20175315 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Zoning, Pat’e Palo - 251 Dyckman St, Manhattan (20175315 TCM)

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to training for preventive services employees
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Training for preventive services employees.

Items.Title: Resolution proclaiming May 6th, the 135th anniversary of President Chester Arthur signing the Chinese Exclusion Act, as a Day of Inclusion in recognition of the harm caused by racially discriminatory immigration measures and to honor the contributions of all immigrants and refugees who have enriched our communities.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Proclaiming May 6th, the 135th anniversary of President Chester Arthur signing the Chinese Exclusion Act.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Employee Retirement System to determine that members are disabled for purposes of accidental disability pensions, if both the New York State Workers’ Compensation Board and U.S. Social Security Administration determine that a member is disabled
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: NYCERS to determine that members are disabled for purposes of accidental disability pensions, if both the NYS Workers’ Compensation Board and U.S. Social Security Administration determine that a member is disabled.

Items.Title: Resolution honoring Sheila Abdus-Salaam, Associate Judge of the New York State Court of Appeals, for her service to the State and City of New York.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Honoring Sheila Abdus-Salaam, Associate Judge of the NYS Court of Appeals.

Items.Title: Resolution honoring the life of comedian Charlie Murphy.
Items.AgendaNote: Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Cultural Affairs, Libraries and International Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Honoring the life of comedian Charlie Murphy.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to having an inspector general within the department of investigation who would monitor only the department of homeless services and the human resources administration

Items.MatterName: Having an inspector general within the dept of investigation who would monitor only the dept of homeless services and the human resources administration.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.6134, legislation that would require the New York Public Service Commission to develop recommendations regarding the establishment of microgrids
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Environmental Protection
Items.MatterName: Public Service Commission to develop recommendations regarding the establishment of microgrids. (A.6134)

Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology

Items.Title: Resolution in support of the Home Stability Support plan, which would create a new statewide rent supplement for families and individuals who are eligible for public assistance benefits and who are facing eviction, homelessness, or the loss of housing due to situations such as domestic violence or hazardous living conditions
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Support of the Home Stability Support Plan

Items.Title: Resolution establishing June 8 annually as Teen Mental Health Awareness Day in the City of New York
Items.AgendaNote: Amended and Approved by the Committee on Mental Health, Developmental Disability, Alcoholism, Substance Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Establishing June 8 annually as Teen Mental Health Awareness Day in NYC.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to re-designate and extend Temporary Protected Status for Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone, as these countries have not recovered from the Ebola epidemic and it would be unsafe for nationals currently present in the United States to return home at this time
Items.AgendaNote: Preconsidered - Approved by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.50 of the Council, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) called for a voice vote.  Hearing no objections, the Public Advocate (Ms. James) declared the Resolution to be adopted.

Adopted unanimously by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to re-designate and extend Temporary Protected Status for Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to re-designate and extend Temporary Protected Status for Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone, as these countries have not recovered from the Ebola epidemic and it would be unsafe for nationals currently present in the United States to return home at this time
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security to re-designate and extend Temporary Protected Status for Guinea, Liberia and Sierra Leone.

Items.MinutesNote:
The presence of a quorum was announced by The Public Advocate (Ms. James).

There were 51 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.

Note: The Deputy City Clerk and Acting Clerk of the Council (Ms. Alisa Fuentes) was at the dais at this Meeting held on May 10, 2017.
The Public Advocate (Ms James) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such motion which was decided in the affirmative by the following vote:
